alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 30 at 1:53PM CDT until October 31 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM CDT TUESDAY... ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM TUESDAY TO 9 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 32 expected. For the second Freeze Warning, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 27 expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas and North Mississippi. * WHEN...For the first Freeze Warning, from midnight tonight to 9 AM CDT Tuesday. For the second Freeze Warning, from 9 PM Tuesday to 9 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water intended for outdoor pets and livestock could freeze making it inaccessible.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
